text:
Free softwares are described by the GNU foundation as a softwares that provides four majors liberties to theirs users. The first is that everyone can execute it without any restrictions. The second one is the possibility to study the source code of the software and share it to others. The third is that it can be modified by anyone. And the last one is the possibility to share the software with others with the modifications made.
Some people who don't know well free softwares might think that free software is softwares that are free, like in free beer. The confusion comes from the term 'free' whose meaning can describe both libre, or the fact that you do not have to pay for something. Also you don't have to pay for a lot of free softwares so it doesn't help to clarify things.
 Free softwares are used a lot, even if users don't realise it. For example a lot of websites are running on Linux, that is an operating system, with for example Apache to send HTML content. I am personnaly impressed by what free softwares can do in opposition with proprietary softwares, with far less money to create it.
Also free softwares enable people not to design a completly new software to do the same has the concurrent, this means less work to obtain the same results, because you don't have to do things several time.
I use Linux every time know, with softwares that are not designed to all people like tiling windows manager, that would not be possible with a proprietary software because there would not be enough users to use it.
